## Intro to markdown

Markdown allows you to do things like **bold**, _italic_, and more!

Make a list with Asterisks like:
- \* bold with double-asterisk
- \* italics with underscores
- \* code-type fond with baskticks

you can also use hyphens instead of asterisks.

For a numbered list: 
1. 1\. bold..... 
2. 1\. italic..... 
3. 1\. code..... 

Hyperlinks are line [Hyperlinkedtext](https://mylinks.org)


Load gapminder data in along with plotting package.
```{r load_data}
# This will work
gap <- gapminder

```

```{r make-plot}
#Uses the plot function
plot(lifeExp ~ year, data=gap)
```
